column4: lo; i still cant get a script to run at startup as root.  It's just a script, not a service.. i've tried  'su - root /path/to/file' in rc.local, but that doesnt seem to fly
You dont need to specify su for that. Just the path to the executable.
What kind of file is at the end of that path?
does it matter where the script is located?
if it's in /home/someuser, it will not run as root?
if i just run it with sudo, it works
but I have no idea where to put it so it will go as root on startup
rc.local is the correct place.  Are you sure that root has access to run the script normally?
actually.. it's very interesting.. sometimes the output file does not exist, and then root does not have the rights to write to it
it may be a delicate thing to do.. the script involves altering my cpuspeed.  I may just chmod u+w the whole directory
i think i've got it.. need to test it out =)
bah... this file only exists if a certain command is typed after my WM starts...
dont play with the bot like that. Theres already enough traffic in here.
That package should exist no matter what release you're using.
